alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:38PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Martin, Johnson, northeastern Perry, northwestern Knott, Floyd, central Breathitt, northwestern Pike and Magoffin Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Chandlerville to Quicksand. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Paintsville, Chestnut, Whitehouse, River, Offutt, Stambaugh, Chandlerville, Galen, Nippa and Boons Camp around 745 PM EDT. Wells, Stidham, Tomahawk and Davisport around 750 PM EDT. Inez, Job, Add, Milo, Calf Creek, Evanston, Elmrock, Debord, Pevier and Duco around 755 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Warfield, Hode, Vail, Gunlock, Orchard, Waldo, Beauty, Ordway, Andy, Lovely, Bosco, Hippo, Mid, Garret, Handshoe, Hueysville, Betty, Pyramid, Bolyn, Mousie, Estill, Martin, Wayland, Hunter, Eastern, Langley, Drift, Minnie, Printer, Porter Junction, Blue Moon, Honaker, Dana, Betsy Layne, Justell, Arkansas, Ivel and Banner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.
